Belgium:
Marriage of Charles the Bold and Margaret of York (Now commemorated with the five-yearly Procession of the Golden Tree)
Liège again rises against Burgundian rule.
Army of Charles the Bold reaches Liège.
Six hundred Franchimontois raid the Burgundian encampment outside Liège, failing to dislodge besiegers.
City of Liège pillaged by Burgundian troops.
Charles the Bold orders the city of Liège systematically razed, sparing only the churches and the houses of canons.
